reviews.review: Great game. A little short but worth it.

[h1]HISTOIRE[/h1]
[b]Portal[/b] premier du nom, nous plonge dans les laboratoires d'[b]Aperture Science[/b], dont le contrôle a été pris par GLaDOS, une IA qui aime bien faire des tests, et ô combien sadique. Nous contrôlons le personnage de [b]Chell[/b] et nous devrons donc réussir à passer les tests de GLaDOS, à l'aide d'une arme emblématique du jeu-vidéo, le [b]Portal Gun[/b], qui permet de générer des portails et se téléporter à différents endroits du test. Notre but est d'arriver au bout de ces tests, et de sortir de ces labos, en vie.

[h1]GAMEPLAY[/h1]
Un jeu de réflexion d'un nouveau genre, qui se joue en FPS, et dont les seuls mouvements possibles sont : Générer des portails, marcher, et porter des objets. Ces mécaniques simples nous permettront d'avancer dans les salles de test, qui se compliqueront au fur et à mesure. En effet, plus on avance dans les tests, et plus on voit de nouvelles technologies apparaître et à assimiler. Les barrières qui désintègrent les objets, les sphères d'énergie, ou encore (et ça c'est de la physique), se servir de notre vélocité pour atteindre des plateformes beaucoup trop lointaines.

[h1]GRAPHISMES[/h1]
Le jeu commence à dater, il s'approche en effet des 10 ans (s'il ne les a pas déjà), les graphismes prennent donc un coup par rapport aux différents jeux que l'on peut sortir. Mais pour Portal, on est tellement bien plongé dans l'univers (qui est le même que [b]Half-Life[/b]) que les graphismes nous importent peu, et qu'ils sont largement suffisants pour profiter pleinement du jeu.

[h1]DUREE DE VIE[/h1]
Malheureusement, c'est là où le jeu a du mal. Pour finir l'histoire principale, il faut compter entre 2 et 3 heures, ce qui est vraiment peu. Le jeu essaiera tant bien que mal de se rattraper avec des salles de test avancées (qui sont les mêmes salles que celles de l'histoire mais en plus compliquées, avec des contraintes supplémentaires), et les défis. Ces fameux défis. Ils reprennent les salles de test 13 à 18, en obligeant le joueur à faire le moins de pas, le moins de portails, et le moins de temps. On en reparle dans le point suivant.

[h1]DIFFICULTE[/h1]
"PUTAIN ! MAIS POURQUOI CA M'A COMPTE UN PAS POUR RIEN?!" ou encore "ALLEZ, J'AI FAIS 11 PAS POUR 10, PUTAIN DE JEU DE MERDE". Voilà les différentes répliques que vous pourrez utiliser lorsque vous essaierez d'avoir tous les défis en Or. J'ai préféré ne pas tout consigner ici. Pour avoir les médailles d'or, il faudra recommencer, encore et encore et encore, pour faire ce qui est demandé, ce qui pousse à sauvegarder dès qu'on a franchi une étape d'une salle et que notre nombre de pas est potable. Pour ce qui est du jeu principal, la difficulté s'accroit au fur et à mesure, mais rien de bien exceptionnel. Les salles de test avancées pourront parfois donner du fil à retordre.

[h1]AVIS[/h1]
Très bon jeu de réflexion, mais surpassé (et c'est tout à fait normal) par [b]Portal 2[/b], qui reste, selon moi, indétronable.
Un peu court à mon avis, mais c'est compensé par l'humour présent dans le jeu, à travers les répliques de GLaDOS et des tourelles. J'espère que la personne qui a inventé les défis de Portal est actuellement en train de souffrir :p

[b]Les plus[/b]
[list]
[*]L'humour
[*]Le gameplay
[*]l'histoire
[*]Le "Je nous vais hais pas" ou encore le "Je ne vous en veux pas" des tourelles
[*]Les répliques et la voix de GLaDOS
[/list]
[b]Les moins[/b]
[list]
[*]La durée de vie
[*]Et un peu la difficulté (trop absente dans le jeu, et trop présente dans les défis)
[/list]

[h1] [b] ゲームシステム、世界観、ストーリーなど、全てがこの上なく素晴らしい最高のゲーム [/b] [/h1]

Steamの運営元である、Valve Corporationが開発したアクションパズルゲーム。FPSにパズルを取り込んだ事や、「ポータル」を使った斬新なゲームシステムが話題となり、世界中で大ヒットを記録した。自分がSteamやPCゲームにハマるきっかけになった大好きなゲーム。

[b] 評価点 [/b]
[list]
[*] 「ポータル」を使った斬新なゲームシステムが非常に面白い。パズルの自由度も高い。
[*] マップが非常によく作りこまれている。
[*] 親切なチュートリアルで初心者でもわかりやすい。
[*] 近未来的な世界観や雰囲気がよく出ている。
[*] 実は存在する奥の深いストーリー。
[*] 数は少ないが個性的なキャラクターが登場。
[*] やりこみがいのあるボーナスマップ。これだけでも結構プレイできる。
[*] カスタムマップを導入すればさらに多くのパズルに挑戦できる。
[/list]
[b] 問題点 [/b]
[list]
[*] パズルゲーム故に飽きが早い。
[*] 人によっては酔いやすいらしい。
[*]Valveのゲームではお馴染みの事だが、デフォルトで日本語字幕がオフになっている。
[/list]

現在では600円とかなり手を出しやすい価格になっているので、Steamを始めた方は絶対に購入をおすすめする。

Voy a ser lo mas sincero posible... Me pase este juego por Glados. Si no hubiera sido por ella no hubiera querido seguir jugando  y pasando de sala en sala. Solo queria pasarme las salas para saber que era lo siguiente que me iba a decir esta inteligencia artificial, que comentario brillante iba a soltar aquella voz que nos observaba, que broma o chiste contara para hacer que nuestro progreso se vea recompesando. Ese es el verdadero motivo por el cual me pase este juego.

Awesome

I have slightly mixed opinions on this game. Although the pros outweigh the cons (and because, when buying the Portal Bundle on sale, the game costs maybe 40 cents), there are some things that make me want to slap the developers across the face.

But let's start this off with typical [Attribute] [Score] system.
Sound and Music: 7/10 - Sounds are completely uninteresting. Music, although rather scarce and definitely not something I could listen to out of context, creates a rather claustrophobic, unsettling atmosphere. Where the music's present it fits and sounds well, however for the most part there's barely any music playing. Still Alive remains one of my favourite songs in games to this day.
Visuals: 7/10 - I wouldn't call this game pretty, but I wouldn't call it ugly, either. Just like with sounds, it's implemented well, but the game's design doesn't create any places where I could say "Ooh, pretty" or "Ugh, ugly".
Gameplay - 9.5/10 - This game is made in Source engine, just like almost all Valve games (this includes titles like Half-Life 2, Team Fortress 2, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive and Portal 2), so if you've played any of them, the controls will be familiar to you. The main gameplay component of the game, Portals, is incorporated well, with pretty much the whole game being the tutorial, constantly presenting you with new gameplay mechanics and letting you get accustomed with them, all the while presenting you with more complex and difficult puzzles.

Keep in mind that the game is quite short. Playing through the game once will take no more than 2 hours, while getting every achievement will take about 10 hours (or a lot more, if you decide to not look up guides for the challenges), and, unlike Portal 2, it doesn't have access to fanmade content, so the replay ability is nearly non-existent. The main game is entertaining from start to finish, and the advanced chambers (of which there are six) provide an extra challenge and finishing them feels rewarding. There is another addition to the game, though, which consists of 6 test chambers with 3 different challenges; Least Portals, Least Steps and Least Time, all of which have three different medals (and 3 achievements associated with those medals), depending on how well you accomplish them. This part of the game made me want to post a "Not Recommended" review. Am I just too bad to complete these? I consider myself "in the middle" when it comes to skill in this game, meaning I'm not good, but not bad, either. The problem isn't that some of these are hard puzzles - the problem is that many of these require either glitches, or solutions so elaborate, that you'd need an IQ of 150 or higher to come up with them without help from online videos and guides. For example, the Least Time challenge for Chamber 16 requires you to use a glitch (not a trick, a glitch) that makes you go through walls and skip 70% of the puzzle. How do I know that it [b]requires[/b] you to do that? Because when you do it, you're not left with a lot of extra time - you can actually fail quite often, if you're just a second or two too slow. The challenges for Least Footsteps and Least Time in Chamber 18 require you to... use a computer case available in a semi-hidden room to jam the exit door, so that you don't have to retreive the box, skipping about 50% of the puzzle. Not all challenges are like that, some of them just require elaborate moves and clever thinking, but some of them just take it too far and require you to exploit glitches or use mechanics not even touched upon in the original game to have any chance of getting a silver or gold medal.

Overall, if you're a casual gamer who won't try to complete the game in 100%, then buy this game and enjoy it. However, if you like getting every achievement, then this game will test your patience and resourcefullness to its limits.

Wonderful little game, which I found to be very fun and engaging. The puzzles are challenging, but not too hard and the story and atmosphere are outstanding, as you are guided by the often sarcastic and sometimes horrifying GLaDOS. Though the game is quite short (I was able to beat it in just under 3 hours), don't hesitate on picking it up if you like puzzle games at all, especially if it is on sale (its price during the Steam Summer Sale was an outright steal!). Overall, I give this game a 10 out of 10 for its memorable characters and challenging and fun puzzles. Buy a copy for you, your friend, your grandma, your dog, your mailman, your boss, or anyone else you can think of. That is how good this game is.

Bu çeşit bulmaca oyunlarıyla pek içli dışlı değilim ama muhtemelen türünün en iyisi bu oyundur. Silahı kullanması zevkli, çeşitli zorluklarda çeşitli çözüm yollarıyla muhteşem bölümleri var. Sanki başta bir hikayesi yokmuş gibi geliyor ancak oyunda ilerledikçe oyunun derinleştiğini ve bir hikayesinin de olduğunu görüyorsunuz. Tek kelimeyle muazzam...

Utterly brilliant. The puzzles are challenging yet fascinating, the portal mechanic is unique and very fun to use, and even the credit sequence is hilarious yet catchy. I jumped on this game very late, but it's worth a buy, and certainly at $9.99. If you have some time and want to play a cool Puzzle-based First-Person platformer, check this game out.

Portal è un gioco fantastico. Completando rompicapi con l'aiuto di una Portal Gun ci si deve destreggiare nei laboratori abbandonati ma funzionanti di Aperture, la cui atmosfera solitaria e alienante è una delle caratteristiche principali del gioco, che vi prenderà per mano nella spiegazione delle meccaniche riguardo alla Portal Gun e agli altri oggetti, ma non nella spiegazione della trama, molto interessante quanto misteriosa, che avrete modo di capire da soli andando avanti man mano nel gioco
Sono passati 10 anni dalla sua uscita, ma è un must have per gli amanti del genere rompicapo, anche una volta che l'avrete finito potrete rigiocarlo e non vi stancherà mai

Questo gioco è BELLISSIMO! Uno dei migliori della Valve e di tutto l'universo! Può competere con Half-Life 2!

Allora, analizziamo tutto...

GRAFICA: 6.5/10  Vabbè, è un gioco che ha i suoi anni, quindi questo voto non va considerato troppo...

GAMEPLAY: 9/10  E' un gioco divertente, anche se è un puzzle game e può fare venire i nervi a qualcuno... Il gioco ha 
                             anche un'ottima storia ed il gameplay all'inizio è monotono, ma anche se lo è vi divertirete lo stesso,  
                             fine varia e da' adrenalina ed ansia di sapere la fine.

VOICE ACTING: 8.5/10  Il voice acting è semplicemente sublime, anche se esiste solo una voce in tutto il gioco, quella di 
                                       GLaDOS.

VOTO FINALE: 9/10

Portal is an instant classic and paved the way for a new approach to first person puzzle games. It's a game worth digging up every few years, replaying the levels and enjoying the narration.

The puzzles are wonderfully logical, yet require a pinch of dexterity and timing. With every level, the complexity increases incrementally so that finding and executing the solutions holds a good balance between challenge and success. After completing certain levels of the main game, advanced versions of those levels with revised conditions or levels with goal-based challenges can be played.

Subject to its setting, Portal builds a visually and aurally dense atmosphere. Besides the fitting ambient sound, the voice acting is superbly done. Thanks to the witty dialogue written for her, the narrator and antagonist GLaDOS is hilarious. Also, the catchy credit song “Still Alive” still gets to me on a monthly basis ...

The only nitpicky nuisance in the game is the typical Source engine carrying technique. Accidentally letting go of picked up items because of jumps or weird collision detection can be mildly frustrating. Apart from that though, Portal is perfect.

Portal should be in everyone's library, as it's nothing short of a timeless epitome of PC gaming.

Very addictive and some of the puzzle were very well made on the plus side, I just wished the game could of been a little bit longer with more story to it. apart from that its a 7/10
buen juego lo pille muy rebajado, muy corto lo unico 2 a 3 horas , que mal que no se registren las hrs offline

One of my favorite games of all time. A complete joy to play from start to finish. 


-The puzzles are very engaging and unique. All of them were fun to play and solve. Started out simple and gradually increased difficulty a perfect ammount. 

-Lovely story and characters. Voice acting is top notch. Great sense of humor. 

-Unique enviroment and world building. The game has it's own distinct voice which is great. 


Please get this game if you haven't already!!!
